poem:
Title: Between the Lines of Debate

"Oh," a discourse de jour,
horror and the daily bloom,
so much, so little in seeming.
Alien, journey in the stars,
is it not dread's dream?
Reflections of the familiar,
Mary's child, Midsommar's sun,
still, amidst intolerant typos,
should we abstain from voice?
Beneath virtual venom,
lies a quest for understanding,
in cool silence, we concede defeat.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Everyone’s so intolerant online. Am I right to stay silent? A few years ago, I found myself in an unexpected debate. My date and I had been talking about horror films. I’d always enjoyed them; he wasn’t a fan. He liked Alien, though. My response was immediate: “Alien’s not a horror film.” Horror films, I said, reflect the everyday: Rosemary’s Baby (pregnancy), Hereditary (grief), Midsommar (a semester abroad). Alien, being set in space, was sci-fi.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Everyone’s so intolerant online. Am I right to stay silent? A few years ago, I found myself in an unexpected debate. My date and I had been talking about horror films. I’d always enjoyed them; he wasn’t a fan. He liked Alien, though. My response was immediate: “Alien’s not a horror film.” Horror films, I said, reflect the everyday: Rosemary’s Baby (pregnancy), Hereditary (grief), Midsommar (a semester abroad). Alien, being set in space, was sci-fi.
